Keywords: Asgardian , Deity , Future , Mystical , Past , Politician
Real Name: Loki Laufeyson
Special Powers
(+5 POINTS) THE TESSERACT: Loki starts the game with the Disney+ #s006 Tesseract equipped.
A POLITICIAN YOU CAN TRUST: Leadership, Shape Change. When Loki uses either and succeeds, give him a Broken Promise token (maximum 3). // When Loki is hit by an opponent's attack, remove all his Broken Promise tokens. // If Loki has 3 Broken Promise tokens, he has "FREE: Choose an opposing character within range and deal them 1 penetrating damage. After resolutions roll a d6. 1-3: Remove a Broken Promise token."
COME ON... WHAT DID YOU EXPECT?: Outwit, but can use it an additional number of times equal to his Broken Promise tokens. Protected: Outwit.
TARGETING: Hindering
Trade Loki Want Loki

August 17, 2022
boow
Just to clarify, when Loki masterminds to someone else, he is no longer "hit" for purposes of the Broken Promises tokens? Mastermind says "When this character would be hit by an opponent’s attack that deals damage, you may choose an adjacent friendly character that wouldn’t be hit by this attack and that is less points or shares a keyword. That friendly character instead becomes a hit target of the attack, even if it’s already a target (or would be an illegal target)" By using the word 'instead' it does mean that Loki itself is no longer hit?
June 13, 2022
AdmiralB
I played him in sealed twice. He's fun, but difficult. If you can get any Broken Promise tokens he just gets so much more annoying and becomes a bigger and bigger threat. I had the 3 tokens on him and just would outwit everything, it was stupid. Once he falls off the special outwit, you have to start using them to deal those penetrating damage clix; I did it 3 times and rolled well, killed a common Gamora with it. Yes, fodder is nice for his mastermind, and if you have something nice to use as it, he's that much better, but Shape Change is where it's at.
June 13, 2022
Oathful
Slightly revising my opinion here, This Loki is a very nuanced figure to play right. I still see him as more of a casual figure than competitive, but with his keyword selection he has ample support for many teams he could be on that can manipulate his d6 rolls with Leadership and Shape Change to help him stack those tokens. Definitely a piece where if your rolls are good and you know what you're doing with him, he will excel and pay his points back in dividends. Otherwise he is an OK secondary attacker/support unit. Thematic: 8.5/10 Viability: 6.5/10, but mileage varies depending on your skill Fun Factor: 8.5/10, leans towards casual
June 9, 2022
muel0017
[QUOTE=Goop;12195385]The lack of stealth really hurts this piece. You are gonna have to have some good mastermind fodder for him to send off otherwise he will just die way too fast. He seems too reliant on that shape change to keep him up. Yeah if you hit your Leadership rolls he can be doing FOUR outwits but thats going to take a while to get going and he will likely be dead before that ever happens. This would have been a better piece if it was redesigned to be cheaper cost support. 75 is a lot for all this chaos.[/QUOTE] your take on this figure is so bad (like all of your takes). I don't even know how to put into words how wrong you are on this.
May 7, 2022
Goop
The lack of stealth really hurts this piece. You are gonna have to have some good mastermind fodder for him to send off otherwise he will just die way too fast. He seems too reliant on that shape change to keep him up. Yeah if you hit your Leadership rolls he can be doing FOUR outwits but thats going to take a while to get going and he will likely be dead before that ever happens. This would have been a better piece if it was redesigned to be cheaper cost support. 75 is a lot for all this chaos.
